page.title: 07Nidderdale Recreation Centre
page.content: The Recreation centre was opened in 1980. It is half built with concrete blocks and the top half is made from corrugated steel, supported by steel girders. Perspex is used on the roof for natural lighting. The centre has two squash courts,three outdoor tennis courts, an all-weather pitch and one sports hall (32.5m x 22.3m). There are also showers, changing rooms and a licensed bar. It employs fourteen to sixteen people, only three of which are full-time. The centre is next to the Nidderdale High School, which uses its facilities for physical exercise. The centre's catchment area has a ten mile radius with 8000 people in it. About 32000 people use it each year. On weekdays it opens from 6pm to 11pm, on Saturday from 9am to 11pm and on Sunday from 9am to 10.30pm. Squash and badminton are the most popular games.
